description.xhtml:p: /etc/passwd must be writable only by its owner.
If the passwd file is writable by a group-owner or the world, the risk of passwd file compromise is increased. The passwd file contains the list of accounts on the system and associated information.

Rule.title: Check the owner of the shadow file.

description.xhtml:p: The /etc/shadow file contains the list of local system accounts. It is vital to system security and must be protected from unauthorized modification. Failure to give ownership of sensitive files or utilities to root or bin provides the designated owner and unauthorized users with the potential to access sensitive information or change the system configuration which could weaken the system's security posture.

Rule.title: Check the permissions of the shadow file.

description.xhtml:p: /etc/shadow must only be accessible by its owner.

The /etc/shadow file contains the list of local system accounts. It is vital to system security and must be protected from unauthorized modification. The file also contains password hashes which must not be accessible to users other than root.
